title: How to Care for Your Pet Rock

steps.title: Pick a rock.
steps.content: Pick a rock. This is a crucial step as every rock is different and unique! You can find different rocks at the park, your garden, at a beach, etc. Make sure you pick a good one!

steps.title: Determine whether its size is convenient for your purpose.
steps.content: Determine whether its size is convenient for your purpose. If it's for a traveling companion, pick a small one. If it's for a friend, a larger size is best. But you can adjust to what you want. If you want one that's medium or extra small - pick it! It's up to you. It's your special rock.

steps.title: Bathe your pet rock.
steps.content: Bathe your pet rock. Bathing your pet rock always needs patience, as some kinds of rocks like to bathe on their own. This is different for every single kind. For bathing, you need at least 1½ (one and a half) room bigger than the rock itself, as the rock might not bathe inside if it's smaller. You'll need to bathe the rock with water and soap, and bathe it slowly. You can't bathe it too quickly as your pet rock wouldn't be too clean.

steps.title: Congratulations!
steps.content: Congratulations! Now you are a responsible owner of your best friend pet rock!

steps.title: Give your rock a name.
steps.content: Give your rock a name. Before you do anything else, you should name your rock. You could give your rock simple names like Rocky, or settle with an exotic name, like Star or Diamond. Make sure it suits you and your rock. Be creative and maybe name your rock a type of berry or a flower. Like for example the name Lemon, it might have little yellow cracks or be yellow. You may call it Blossom, if it is slightly tinted pink or a white color.You can also name it after a character from a movie or tv show.Or you can give it two names and have a cool nickname for your rock You should also determine your pet's "gender". If you can't decide, think of whatever name you like, boy or girl.

steps.title: Look at your rock’s appearance.
steps.content: Look at your rock’s appearance. If it's bumpy or smooth, give it a name that suits it. Get to know it's appearance to ensure you've picked the right name.

steps.title: Look to baby name sites for inspiration for a name.
steps.content: Look to baby name sites for inspiration for a name. For example, you can search "baby names" in Google. It will give you plenty of names to look through. Consider this advice: Make a list of all the names you want, then narrow it down. Remember, you can always give the rock a middle name and a last name!

steps.title: Feed your pet rock!
steps.content: Feed your pet rock! It can't eat physical objects, so provide it with food for its other senses, such as sight, touch, smell, and hearing. You can play sweet music, paint or print of a nice image, find something soft, that kind of thing. If you can't print or find anything that smells nice, try to see if your rock is interested in looking at your food. If you are comfortable with it, your rock could even smell your food.

steps.title: Make a potpourri for your rock to smell.
steps.content: Make a potpourri for your rock to smell. This is only if you can. If you're a young child, ask an adult to assist. Add some lemon or orange peels to a handful of cloves. You can also add rose petals, mint, or lavender.

steps.title: Paint or print a pretty picture.
steps.content: Paint or print a pretty picture. Again, you can just let it see what you do for snacks.

steps.title: Play some music.
steps.content: Play some music. Classical music will do nicely. If you don't like classical music, your rock can still be comfortable with catchy pop. Despite their name, pet rocks don't normally like rock music.

steps.title: Make a texture board by gluing pieces of different materials to a piece of cardboard.
steps.content: Make a texture board by gluing pieces of different materials to a piece of cardboard. Rub your pet rock over these different textures. This is a good idea for if your rock gets a bit rough.

steps.title: Prepare a cup of warm water.
steps.content: Prepare a cup of warm water. You'll want a nice wide bowl.

steps.title: Add some liquid soap.
steps.content: Add some liquid soap. Stir it together, and carefully place your rock inside the mix. But before you do, check the rock's type. Some rocks may not be able to go in water.

steps.title: Use a sponge or a cloth to scrub your pet rock inside with the soap-water mixture.
steps.content: Use a sponge or a cloth to scrub your pet rock inside with the soap-water mixture. If you can't use any of these, use your hands. Scrub for 2-4 minutes. Make sure it rubs all over, under any crevices.

steps.title: Dry your pet rock with a small cloth.
steps.content: Dry your pet rock with a small cloth. Now, let your pet rock rest. Bathing is very important when "pet rocking", and rocks like to contemplate their day after a relaxing bath. You may need to redo any text/pen that you may have drawn on.

steps.title: Take a cardboard box and cut a small window in the side with sharp scissors.
steps.content: Take a cardboard box and cut a small window in the side with sharp scissors. If you are a child, ask and adult to help.

steps.title: Remove the lid and place a small box (for example, a matchbox or Altoids box) against a corner of the box.
steps.content: Remove the lid and place a small box (for example, a matchbox or Altoids box) against a corner of the box. Fill it with a soft material, such as cotton, felt, or some cloth. Newspaper shreds will do nicely.

steps.title: Create a rug.
steps.content: Create a rug. Do this by cutting a piece of fabric or material and gluing it to the bottom of the box. Make sure it fits the whole area.

steps.title: Make a beanbag couch.
steps.content: Make a beanbag couch. Either purchase one or stuffing a small drawstring purse with cotton or crumpled newspaper will work as well.

steps.title: Make a litter-box.
steps.content: Make a litter-box. Place newspaper shreds in a matchbox.

steps.title: Create a lounge.
steps.content: Create a lounge. Make a couch-shaped 3D piece of cardboard and place tiny pillows from a dolls house on it. If you don't have doll pillows, try sewing a little pillow. Set the beanbag couch on the side, and make a table by setting a piece of sturdy material over four pebbles. You could glue them on.

steps.title: Make a dining room.
steps.content: Make a dining room. Place a mini potpourri in the corner. You can also play some music.

steps.title: Discover your rock's favorite color.
steps.content: Discover your rock's favorite color. It can depend on your pet's breed. Use this color for the carpeting in the house.

steps.title: Travel with your pet rock!
steps.content: Travel with your pet rock! Bring it to school, on a vacation or just take a nature walk with your pet.

steps.title: Make a little house for traveling by following these steps:
steps.content: Make a little house for traveling by following these steps: Use a box big enough for your rock. You can add an attachment for its belongings.

steps.title: Cut two opposite flaps on the box.
steps.content: Cut two opposite flaps on the box. The remaining flaps are to be folded about 3-4cm away from the ends.

steps.title: Make a slit in the folded part of the flap.
steps.content: Make a slit in the folded part of the flap. Please ensure that when you close the box the slits are lined up.

steps.title: Cut out a long piece of cardboard from the leftover flaps.
steps.content: Cut out a long piece of cardboard from the leftover flaps. Remember to make the width a tad smaller than the slit, so that it slides in effortlessly. Fold it.

steps.title: Shred some newspaper (although tearing it up is more fun).
steps.content: Shred some newspaper (although tearing it up is more fun). Fill the box halfway with shredding and it's ready for use!

steps.title: Protect your rock when going into new or foreign places.
steps.content: Protect your rock when going into new or foreign places. Rocks can get sick too! They may pick up moss, fungi, lichen, and other unwanted diseases.

steps.title: Create a spa day, using the instructions below:
steps.content: Create a spa day, using the instructions below: Throw dried flower petals into some hot water and mix in very little bubble mix. Massage your pet rock! Rub the nooks and crannies with petroleum jelly or baby oil. You could also get some other rocks to come.

steps.title: Throw a sleepover with your pet rock:
steps.content: Throw a sleepover with your pet rock: Invite some friends, whether they have pet rocks or not. If they don't, you may wish to surprise them some. Grab some of your favorite snacks, and feed your pet rock as well. Remember they must use the senses other than taste! When it's time to go to sleep, bring your pet rock's bed with you in your sleeping bag. Tonight, you sleep with your special pet. If you don't want to, put the rock in it's home. If your friends brought or have been given pet rocks, place them in as well. Remember which rock belongs to who, though!

steps.title: Have a birthday party!
steps.content: Have a birthday party! If you remember the day you found your pet rock, a birthday party is a great way to celebrate each year you and your pet spend together. If you don't, host it whenever you like! A few ways to remember your rocks birthday is by writing it down somewhere safe, like on a fridge, or adding it to a calendar. Make a special meal for you and your rock. Keep in mind it can't eat your food, but you can eat yours. Spend some alone time together. Maybe play a game.

steps.title: Make a home cinema!
steps.content: Make a home cinema! It's a great way for you and your pet rock to spend some quality time together. First of all, find a thin card (this will be used as a wall so find a box with walls the same size, if needed cut to size) or buy one.

steps.title: Measure your phone or tablet.
steps.content: Measure your phone or tablet. Cut out a hole in the card the same size as the screen.

steps.title: Ensure the screen is visible.
steps.content: Ensure the screen is visible. When complete, cut out one side of the wall on your box and glue your cut out wall in its place. Make sure that you are happy with it,

steps.title: Create a support for your iPhone/iPod on the back of the wall.
steps.content: Create a support for your iPhone/iPod on the back of the wall.

steps.title: Cut and glue a piece of card (preferably rectangular) to the back of the support.
steps.content: Cut and glue a piece of card (preferably rectangular) to the back of the support.

steps.title: Slip your phone onto the support.
steps.content: Slip your phone onto the support. Put your favorite movie or video on, pop some corn. And of course give your fellow friend a little beanbag to relax on, sit back, relax, and enjoy!
